suncertify.db
Class RecordLockingManager

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.RecordLockingManager

 class RecordLockingManager
extends java.lang.Object

This is the worker class that handles logically reserving and releasing a contractor record.

Note: that since this should only be used by the DBAccessImp class, the class has been set to have default access.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Black

Field Summary
private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long> lockedRecords
          A HashMap that contains a Long key that holds a the record number and a Long that holds the currently reserved contractor client cookie.

Field Detail

lockedRecords

private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Long> lockedRecords
A HashMap that contains a Long key that holds a the record number and a Long that holds the currently reserved contractor client cookie.

Constructor Detail

RecordLockingManager

RecordLockingManager()
Method Detail

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo,
                       DatabaseFileAccess fileAccess)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
This method locks a record if it is not locked already which is indicated by checking the lockedRecords HashMap for the presents of the record number in question. If the record number is locked, the the current Thread will go into wait state giving up the CPU cycles until it is notified of the record release.

Parameters:
recNo - the contractor record to be reserved.
fileAccess - the fileAcces object used to check if the record exists.
Returns:
the clients cookie to be used to unlock the record later.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record is deleted or doesn't exist.

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
This method unlocks the record if the client is the same client that had originally locked the record with the same client cookie.

Parameters:
recNo - the record number to be unlocked.
cookie - the client cookie obtained from locking a record.
Throws:
SecurityException - thrown if the client cookie is not the same as the client cookie obtained when record was locked.

isCorrectClient

public boolean isCorrectClient(long recNo,
                               long clientCookie)
This method checks that the client had locked a record by checking its locking cookie with the one stored in this HashMap related to the record number.

Parameters:
recNo - the record number in question.
clientCookie - the cookie the client has submitted for check.
Returns:
true if the cookies are the same and false if not.
